description.narrative: PIPS under this tax justice project aims to reduce social and economic inequalities <(>&<)> poverty, which ultimately leads to inclusive development and empowerment for all citizens of Pakistan. The targeted outcomes of the project are the making a National Action Plan on Business <(>&<)> Human Right, Capacity building of Parliamentarians/ legislators and bridging connections with Govt. Legislative Institutes. The project will work at federal level mainly engaging private sector, Civil society groups, Govt. Institutions etc. The major outcome of the project is to contribute in making a National Action Plan on Business <(>&<)> Human Rights through consultative process. It also aims to support Federal and Punjab Province governments to gradually increase pubic allocations on education, health <(>&<)> social protection and ensure efficient utilization of allocated resources by building capacity of parliamentarians and key decision makers. PIPS will facilitate mainly the parliamentarians, private sector, legislative institutions on board to engage government in the form of charter of demand, make inclusive consultations to form NAP on Business <(>&<)> Human Rights for pro-poor gender sensitized budgetary allocation on social essential services i.e., health, education etc. On the other hand, this project will continue to contribute to Even it Up campaign of Oxfam Novib at global level by working on the following aspects: a) Improved policies and elements of tax system. b) Increasing citizens# voice by strengthening capacity of civilsociety and citizens to demand a fair and progressive tax system through. c) Focusing on broadening the tax base and demanding increased allocation of funds for education, health and other basic needs the proposed project will also contribute to the #Even it Up# focus area of urging the governments to Invest in universal, free public services and ensure adequate safety nets for the poorest.

participating-org.narrative:
Young Parliamentarians Forum YPF is a forum established in 2003 with the purpose to help young legislators understand the issues that youth face, and to provide them with the knowledge and skills to be better lawmakers and ambassadors of tomorrow . It consists ofmembers who were 40 years of age or under at the time of election. This Forum is also expected to provide young legislators with the leadership skills to act as a catalyst for change in Pakistan<(>&<)>#39;s political system and pioneer meaningful reforms.
Current elected parliament beholds large percentage of youth many of whom are first time legislators. Thus this forum provides them with excellent opportunity to harness their energies and enthusiasm, develop and share ideas, improve their legislative and leadership skills to form inter regional and inter-party networks.
In order to perform their duties each young legislator must know how to initiate and support legislation (keeping in mind the ground realities) that can improve the conditions of their constituents. They must understand the imperatives of economic development, and must play a proactive role in policy making by keeping tabs on all the developments and limitations of developing policies within given frameworks of international powers. Furthermore any international events that may have a direct impact on our social, cultural and economic realities must be known inside out by them in order to work on all factors by keeping in mind its pragmatic effects at national and provincial level.
